examples.input: The 'NeuroLink' brain-computer interface (BCI) allows users to control prosthetic limbs with thought. It uses an array of 1024 microelectrodes implanted in the motor cortex. Data bandwidth is 1 Gbps. Clinical trials have shown an 85% success rate in restoring complex motor functions. The device also provides sensory feedback. Development was led by Dr. Aris Thorne at 'Cyborg Dynamics'. Next generation aims for non-invasive BCI.
